doc.after: The city of Tiruchirappalli lies on the plains between the Shevaroy Hills to the north and the Palni Hills to the south and south-west.[95] Tiruchirappalli is completely surrounded by agricultural fields.[66] Densely populated industrial and residential areas have recently been built in the northern part of the city, and the southern edge also has residential areas.[66] The older part of Tiruchirappalli, within the Rockfort, is unplanned and congested while the adjoining newer sections are better executed.[96] Many of the old houses in Srirangam were constructed according to the shilpa sastras, the canonical texts of Hindu temple architecture.[97]
